brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study is to assess the efficacy and safety of restarting ruxolitinib after
      treatment interruption due to loss of response and/or adverse events.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase II Study of Re-treatment of Myelofibrosis Patients With Ruxolitinib/Jakavi After Treatment Interruption Due to Loss of Response and/or Adverse Event (ReTreatment Trial)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Confirmed diagnosis of PMF, PPV MF or PET-MF, irrespective of JAK2 mutational status
             according to the 2008 revised International Standard Criteria

          -  Peripheral blast count < 10%

          -  Requires therapy for MF in the opinion of the investigator

          -  Received prior monotherapy treatment with ruxolitinib for at least 12 consecutive
             weeks and experienced treatment interruption because of lossof response or adverse
             event

          -  Patients adhering to the Screening phase assessments and undergoing a a
             ruxolitinib-free washout period of a minimum of 1 week and a maximum of 8 weeks

          -  ECOG performance status 0, 1, 2, or 3

          -  Adequate bone marrow function

          -  Written informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients not initially responding (primary resistance) to ruxolitinib therapy

          -  Patients who underwent a splenectomy or spleen radiation

          -  Patients currently scheduled for bone marrow transplant

          -  Patients who have discontinued ruxolitinib < 14 days prior to screening

          -  Patients who are not able to receive a starting dose of ruxolitinib of at least 15 mg
             total daily dose

          -  Leukemic transformation

          -  Inadequate renal function

          -  Presence of clinically meaningful active bacterial, fungal, parasitic or viral
             infection which requires therapy

          -  Previous history of Progressive Multifocal Leuko-encephalopathy (PML)

          -  Clinically significant cardiac disease or significant concurrent medical condition

clinical_study.official_title: The ReTreatment Trial: A Phase II, Open-label, Single-arm Study of Re-treating Myelofibrosis Patients With Ruxolitinib/Jakavi After Treatment Interruption Due to Loss of Response and/or Adverse Event.

authority: Austria: AGES (Bundesamt für Sicherheit im Gesundheitswesen)
Brazil: ANVISA - Agência Nacional de Vigilância Sanitária
Germany: BfArM (Bundesinstitut für Arzneimittel und Medizinprodukte)
Spain: Agencia Española de Medicamentos y Productos Sanitarios
United Kingdom: Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving ≥20% reduction from baseline in spleen volume by Week 24 after re-treatment with ruxolitinib
primary_outcome.measure: The effect of re-treatment with ruxolitinib on reduction in spleen volume of at least 20% from baseline, by Week 24

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving ≥35% reduction from baseline in spleen volume by Week 24 after re-treatment with ruxolitinib
secondary_outcome.measure: The effect of re-treatment with ruxolitinib on reduction in spleen volume of at least 35% from baseline, by Week 24

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving ≥25% and ≥50% reduction respectively, from baseline, in spleen length by Week 24 after re-treatment with ruxolitinib
secondary_outcome.measure: The effect of re-treatment with ruxolitinib on reduction in spleen length of at least 25% and 50% respectively, from baseline, by Week 24

secondary_outcome.description: Change in spleen length as well as in spleen volume from baseline to each visit where measured after re-treatment with ruxolitinib
secondary_outcome.measure: The effect of re-treatment with ruxolitinib on reduction in spleen volume and length over time

secondary_outcome.description: Safety will be assessed by monitoring the frequency, duration and severity of Adverse Events, and evaluating changes in vital signs, electrocardiograms (ECGs), serum chemistry, hematology and urinalysis results.
secondary_outcome.measure: The safety after re-treatment with ruxolitinib

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving ≥25% and ≥50% reduction respectively, from baseline in total symptom score (MPN-SAF TSS) by Week 24 after re-treatment with ruxolitinib
secondary_outcome.measure: The effect of re-treatment with ruxolitinib on reduction in MPN-SAF TSS of at least 25% and 50% respectively, from baseline, by Week 24

secondary_outcome.description: Change in MPN-SAF TSS from baseline to each visit where measured after re-treatment with ruxolitinib
secondary_outcome.measure: The effect of re-treatment with ruxolitinib on reduction in MPN-SAF TSS over time

secondary_outcome.description: PGIC at each visit where measured after retreatment with ruxolitinib
secondary_outcome.measure: The effect of re-treatment with ruxolitinib on Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC)

secondary_outcome.description: Change in EORTC QLQ-C30 and EQ-5 D-5L scores from baseline to each visit where measured after re-treatment with ruxolitinib
secondary_outcome.measure: The effect of re-treatment with ruxolitinib on EORTC QLQ-C30 and EQ-5D-5L
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Day 1, Week 8, Week 12, Week 16, Week 24

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
